urls: ?Farewell to Europe? is a little like Zweig himself: smart, overly fastidious and remote to a fault.

This endlessly fascinating swirl of a film could have come only from Nolan, who blends the cerebral twistiness of Memento (his thriller that moves backward in time) with the spectacular action of his Batman megahit, The Dark Knight.
You can believe this was a show that existed only in this moment and you feel elevated from being a part of it.
A splendid cast work through the complications and stages of grief to provide a scathingly anti-nationalist warning from history.

This quietly poetic little gem contains many beautiful things, not least of which is leading lady Zoe Kazan, who lets every scene billow and swirl around her effortlessly.  Read more: http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/movies/2010/03/12/2010-03-12_s
The result is quite horrific. No-one could be unmoved. But at the same time I did back away from the campaigning elements of the film.
The plot is predictable and the acting is muted but even so this fantasy thriller remains spectacular to watch.
